title: The five Tottenham players Mauricio Pochettino is ready to sell in January
text:
Mauricio Pochettino is ready to sell five Tottenham players in January (Picture: Getty)

Christian Eriksen and Eric Dier are among five Tottenham players who Mauricio Pochettino is ready to offload during the January transfer window, according to reports.

Spurs have endured a dismal start to the new season, winning just three of their eight Premier League fixtures to sit ninth during the second international break of the campaign.

Pochettino’s side finished third last term but have looked a shadow of their former selves in recent weeks and were knocked out of the Carabao Cup by League Two side Colchester United.

Christian Eriksen was strongly linked with a move in the summer (Picture: Getty)

A clear-out is expected to take place at Tottenham this winter, with under-fire manager Pochettino ready to make several players available as he looks to freshen up his under-performing squad.

According to The Times, Pochettino and Spurs will consider offers for Eriksen, Dier, Serge Aurier, Victor Wanyama and Danny Rose.

All five of those players were heavily linked with moves in the summer, with Real Madrid and Manchester United said to be interested in signing Denmark star Eriksen.

England duo Dier and Rose could leave while Pochettino is also keen to offload Aurier, who has flattered to deceive following a £23million move to Spurs two years ago.

Time is also running out for Kenyan midfielder Wanyama, who has started just one fixture this season.

Speaking after Tottenham’s 3-0 defeat to Premier League rivals Brighton, Pochettino insisted he ‘did not fear’ losing his job.

‘No I am not worried, what worries me is life, not football,’ the Spurs boss said.

‘Now in the last two games it was a tough situation to accept. But I don’t want to be a philosopher or talk in a way that is not good.’

Following the international break, Tottenham return to Premier League action with a home match against Watford.
